intro: Raveniopsis jauaensis, commonly known as the Jauaensis Raveniopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring cool and humid conditions. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
